items.content_html: I don’t know many poems by heart but I think I could recite This Be The Verse by Philip Larkin. The first line is one of the most famous in poetry but probably not suitable for family occasions. It’s forthright and pessimistic and easily searchable.

items.title: Dazed and confused...
items.content_html:
Another very funny bit of writing from Marina Hyde. She makes this whole shambles almost bearable.

Dazed and confused, Johnson stumbles into the twilight zone with a police escort | Marina Hyde | Opinion | The Guardian:

As for his turns away from Westminster, Thursday afternoon found him at a Yorkshire police academy, where he appeared deeply confused. He resembled a political Elvis ‚Äì twilight years ‚Äì who‚Äôd had to be slapped awake on the tour bus by his manager, given some of his special medicine, and shoved on to greet the LA crowd with the words ‚ÄúHello Philadelphia!‚Äù This, but in Wakefield.
items.content_text:

items.content_html:
I’m trying to put a link at the top of the Marfa theme to a category. The new category links on the archive page have the address ”/categories/topic”. If I try and save a page with that link the ”/categories” part is stripped out making the url fail. Am I going about this the right way?

edit (2-2-2019): I was going about it the wrong way. All you need to do is add the full url as the contents of the page.
items.content_text:
I'm trying to put a link at the top of the Marfa theme to a category. The new category links on the archive page have the address  *"/categories/topic"*. If I try and save a page with that link the  *"/categories"* part is stripped out making the url fail. Am I going about this the right way?

*edit (2-2-2019): I was going about it the wrong way. All you need to do is add the full url as the contents of the page.*
